channel.title: Sarah Paz
channel.description: Webjeda Cards is a Bootstrap based jekyll theme for portfolio, photography or any kind of blog.

item.title: Curve-stitching
item.description: I made this image on processing using a for loop. This picture is a screenshot of it. My inspiration was from the National STEM fair in the Washington Convention Center. I picked this based on this curve-stitching website.

item.title: Kimchi Juice
item.description:
At Union Market, I met Julia Chon, the creator of Kimchi Juice. Kimchi Juice is a clothing, homeware and print business emblazoned with cute animals “flipping the bird”. Julia was seventeen when she made her business. A year later, she is taking a gap year to explore her art and compete in mural contests.

This picture was found on her website.

item.title: Technica
item.description:
This year I went to Technica which is the largest all girls coding event in the world. It wasn’t 100% female because there were some male mentors and sponsors. As the wifi wasn’t working, I had little to program with (though I am only a novice, anyways). Scheduled throughout the day were tech talks on a range of topics from exploring tech careers in other fields to machine learning.

Chibird

At around 5pm, an artist techie Jaqueline Chen led a talk about the crossroads of art and technology. Using photoshop and other tools, she created motivating cartoons of cute animals. While she was still a high school student, Jaqueline started a blog under the pseudonym chibird.

One of my favorites was one about a cat who was having a lazy day with the response of “that’s okay.” Her book, Loading Penguin hugs, is only $7.69 and has two sticker sheets in the back!

This is not my picture.

item.title: IKEA Sleepovers
item.description:
IKEA sleepovers are a new dare campaign in which customers attempt to stay overnight at IKEA. The vlog of two Belgian teenagers, titled two idiots at night in IKEA, went viral resulting in many other attempted sleepovers. These sleepovers are illegal, however it is unknown whether any of these intruders were prosecuted. According to an Ikea UK spokesperson: “We appreciate that people are interested in Ikea and want to create fun experiences, however the safety and security of our co-workers and customers is our highest priority and that’s why we do not allow sleepovers in our stores.”

There are some legal store run sleepovers that I am researching.
